description: From Latin violātus, past participle of violāre (“treat with violence, whether bodily or mental”), from vīs (“strength, power, force, violence”).

verbs.description: violate (third-person singular simple present violates, present participle violating, simple past and past participle violated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To break or disregard (a rule or convention).
examples: Accessing unauthorized files violates security protocol.

entries.meaning: (transitive, prison slang) To cite (a person) for a parole violation.
examples: If you don't have a job, you can't pay the money, then you get violated and have to go back to prison.
